description: First and second floor rear extension and construction of third floor with mansard roof to accommodate additional eight rooms with en-suites to guesthouse and enclose external staircase
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): Plans: 02 Rev P7, 03 Rev P4, 04 Rev P6, 301 Rev P6, 302 Rev P2, 305 Rev P1, 306 Rev P5
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall match the existing building and be permanently retained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the materials, details and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, as   shown on approved drawing 301 Rev P6 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in an accessible location for flats and have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial sources. Details of the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) shall demonstrate that internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014 will be achieved.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from transport/ industrial/ commercial noise sources, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval, of the external sound level emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment and mitigation measures as appropriate.  The measures shall ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5 dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by mechanical noise, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details of anti-vibration measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council.  The measures shall ensure that the extract/ ventilation system and ducting are mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors are vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details of the method of connecting and holding the extract duct to the building shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
